title: Recover from incorrect placement of `const`, `mut`, `&`, `*`

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

Given the following code: [link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=76abd80a50e7c8c4335a9a6d91612d9a)

```rust
fn inc(num: mut& i32) {
    *num += 1;
}

fn main() {
    let x = 12;
    let _ptr: const* i32 = x&;
 
    let mut y = 34;
    inc(y &mut);
}
```

The current output is:

```
Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error: expected type, found keyword `mut`
 --> src/main.rs:1:13
  |
1 | fn inc(num: mut& i32) {
  |             ^^^ expected type

error: expected type, found keyword `const`
 --> src/main.rs:7:15
  |
7 |     let _ptr: const* i32 = x&;
  |         ----  ^^^^^ expected type
  |         |
  |         while parsing the type for `_ptr`

error[[E0423]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/error-index.html#E0423): expected value, found crate `num`
 --> src/main.rs:2:6
  |
2 |     *num += 1;
  |      ^^^ not a value

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0423`.
error: could not compile `playground` due to 3 previous errors
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally the output should inform the user that for `&` and `*` it goes in front of the keyword or variable and for the `&mut` placed after the variable, a suggestion should be emitted to switch the position of those 2 things.

<!--
If the problem is not self-explanatory, please provide a rationale for the
change.
-->
